abstract: Op-Ed article by Joseph E Stiglitz, Nobel laureate in economics, warns that influence of pharmaceutical companies on Trans-Pacific Partnership trade negotiations may result in higher drug prices worldwide and less innovation; notes that companies are seeking to keep or expand their monopolies on brand-name drugs by restricting competition from generics and undermining government regulation of drug prices.
lead_paragraph: The efforts to raise drug prices in the so-called Trans-Pacific Partnership take us in the wrong direction.
snippet: The efforts to raise drug prices in the so-called Trans-Pacific Partnership take us in the wrong direction.
